described as discontiguous. The lack of uniformity of the observations may be caused by missing
or corrupt values. It may also be a feature of the problem where observations are only made
available sporadically or at increasingly or decreasingly spaced time intervals. In the case of
non-uniform observations, speciﬁc data formatting may be required when ﬁtting some models
to make the observations uniform over time.
 Contiguous. Observations are made uniform over time.
